website_summaries.verdict: While not practical for all consumers, it's an unbeatable deal if the dimensions fit your tires.
pros: An affordable model that holds up to 300 pounds
Folds against the wall when not in use
cons: It's shorter than some of its competitors, which means some tire models may not fit

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy for car tire storage
customer_reviews.text: I’m an using this to store 4 mounted 235/35/19 wheels. Each wheel is about 35lb with tire. The rack comes assembled for the most part and is easy to install. The variable width adjustments make it easy to line up with framing studs behind wall. After I installed it I was able to do slow pull-ups on each cross bar individually and then using both to assure it would stay put, I weigh 180lbs. The cross bars stayed put and straight. For the price, using car tires in my case, this was an excellent value and purchase for me.
customer_reviews.author: Tony TKO

customer_reviews.title: Nice tire storage rack
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to store the off season tires out of the way in the garage. The unit arrived packaged well. The item is painted with a grey paint. It is really easy to install. I used a stud finder to locate the studs to put the lag bolts into. I predrilled all the holes with a 7/32 drill bit. This is a must do. As some else has mentioned, if you want, you can cut a piece of ply wood (46.5 x 22) to make a folding workbench. This is a good unit for storing tires and a good base for a folding workbench. I recommend purchasing this unit if you are in the market.
customer_reviews.author: HK1221123

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install. Adjustable for various tire sizes and positions. Only negative is that they should have included a strap of some kind, not sure my bungee cord is the best solution. But it did get a stack of tires off the ground and out of the way, utilizing space that was completely wasted. As for those that said it wasn't sturdy, they must be overloading it, or installing it wrong. Was very sturdy and perfect for my Tesla Model 3 winter tires/wheels. I wouldn't choose this model for my F350 36" A/T tires, but that isn't what I expected. ;o)
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Rack - Excellent Value.
customer_reviews.text: Good Quality Tire Rack. My four 17" studded snow tires mounted on rims fit perfectly. I upgraded the mounting hardware only because I like to build things to "Brick Sh** House standards. Very happy with the quality and how easy it was to install. It's been installed for over several months now with no signs of sagging or deflection. Make sure you are mounting it to good solid structure such as wall studs. It's nice to see a manufacturer build a good quality product and not overprice it. Excellent Value!
customer_reviews.author: Bake

customer_reviews.title: Very Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Ordered two, for two cars, since I swap out tires between hot and cold seasons. I installed both immediately next to each other...where they meet in the middle; I had to install a wider piece of wood to the stud as the stud would not be wide enough to install right next to one another. Because of this the mounting at the ends also needed a board to bring them 3/4" away from the wall in order to match the spacing at the center. Not a big deal. Anyway, I'm very pleased with these.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job
customer_reviews.text: If you are handy with a drill then you will not have an issue installing the tire rack. Once installed, putting in tires/rims onto the rack is sturdy and fits about 4 tire/rim each. If not in use, you can remove the lock pin and move the rack parallel to the wall. If there was a lever locking mechanism instead of a lock pin would be great. Otherwise, it does a great job.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Wasnt sure about it when it came in, but its sturdy. The existing hardware worked in concrete, just use a 1/4 inch masonry but for a pilot hole and an impact drill to drive the bolts home with washers and itll hold forever. Tricky part was making sure it was even on both side, measure twice then mark your holes!
customer_reviews.author: FireEMT-GaFR

customer_reviews.title: Tire Rack
customer_reviews.text: These opened all the way up are stressed be sure you measure the tires height and width of all four before mounting it. Keep the width as close to the tires width as possible. Mine are in a temp garage mounted to 2x6's so the are not mounted in a garage with 2x4 construction. (much sturdier) I put 19" 235's on one rack and 17" 235's on another. Glad to get them off the ground all the tires are in tire covers.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Van Hoesen

customer_reviews.title: Arrived in pieces, missing all fasteners/hardware.
customer_reviews.text: I just received the item, when box was found on my porch it had both ends opened and all hardware was missing (except two loose lagbolts) but the empty hardware bag was shoved back in. Now I'm stuck with a rack and have no idea what hardware is needed or anything to compare it to at the local hardware store to buy whats missing. Not sure who to contact regarding this problem, since this is the first time this has EVER happened to me.
customer_reviews.author: FunkyMonkey

customer_reviews.title: Wow I love this rack!
customer_reviews.text: Didn't install the cross bars in the correct holes first go around. I assumed the tire size was the rim size. But the manual is using the total diameter of the tire. Sure I could have guessed this but I'd recommend being more specific. You definitely need to get the lag bolts directly in the studs so use a stud finder and triple or more check your work!!! Once installed correctly this unit will hold 4 tires and rims no problem! Real space saver. I now have snow tires and I am feeling much safer about it!
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Messy, but works well
customer_reviews.text: Putting the parts on the garage studs was very easy, especially as you attach the braces before you put in the rails that hold the tires. The only complaint is that these rail supports where covered in this rust colored powder that got on everything in my work area including yours truly. I think this is a good buy and a good price, so now my snow tires have a home off the floor or on the shelves.
customer_reviews.author: Maestro

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: The set came missing 2x Bolts (M8x60, not exactly cheap) and the matching spring washers. Since it's nearly the last step, I didn't notice it. Amazon offered a "return", but it's bolted on my wall and took a long time to put together - just easier to buy the bolts. Annoying quality control. The company left a card to "contact them" if there were any issues, but I haven't heard back... Count the pieces before you start assembling! I gave it 2 stars since it looks like it'll hold tires once I get the bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Alex L

customer_reviews.title: Great product, highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: Great product, came mostly assembled, just needed to be installed with 6 lag bolts for the mounting brackets and 4 bolts for the cross bars. Adjustable depth and width based on the diameter of your tire, which is a plus. Pretty sturdy and helped clear some space in my garage. Be sure to mount it properly into studs (this may affect how wide you can mount it). As you can see I had no problem mounting 4 Honda Odyssey tires easily.
customer_reviews.author: inazarinia

customer_reviews.title: Great space saving option for your garage.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these tire racks for my garage and I am very happy with the quality and finish for the price. The metal used is heavy duty and looks like can handle 200-300lb with no issues. Have had my wheels stored for a few weeks now on this rack with no issues. Make sure to attach the sides to studs or good enough anchors to support the 150lb+ weight.
customer_reviews.author: Slava

customer_reviews.title: Tired of tires?
customer_reviews.text: I was. This rack is so secure. It safely stows my summer wheels in the winter and my winter wheels in the summer. I don't have Spring wheels yet. For extra security, I used a ratchet to secure the wheels onto the framework of the rack. In the time it takes to lose a game of FIFA 2019, which is about 25 minutes, I could install this rack in my garage. Just make sure you find the studs, and I don't mean sexy men. You have to ensure you're securing this into the wall studs; I wouldn't trust drywall mollys, or anyone named Molly for that matter.
customer_reviews.author: titochachang

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for what I needed. Fit my M3 completion wheels which have a meaty rear wheel. Just perfect sizing for the wall studs. I wish I could adjust it but best bang for your buck on this one. I think I would get the girot one for the adjustability.
customer_reviews.author: OC Nelly P

customer_reviews.title: Very happy. Watch mounting height.
customer_reviews.text: These do a great job of holding 5 tires and wheels from my MGB. One thing I that I would do differently, given the chance, is to mount them higher on the wall. The corner of this mount is right at temple level. Ow.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed to store off season mounted tires. I installed this at 48” width and 28” of clearance from the shelf above. They were easy to install and very sturdy with plenty of room for my 27” diameter tires!
customer_reviews.author: MCf

customer_reviews.title: Small Tires only
customer_reviews.text: Deserves NO STARS. Does not fit a standard 245/65/17 Tire for Jeep Grand Cherokee. Description should state for small tires only. Wish I knew this before taking the time to install. I will have to build furring strips to move it further from the wall so tires fit.
customer_reviews.author: RunningSad

customer_reviews.title: 1 Year Later, Still Holding Up
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for both cars extra set of seasonal tires. They were pretty easy to install and have been holding the tires for a year now with no issue. Just make sure you follow the directions and mount them to the studs.
customer_reviews.author: DAVID VIPOND

customer_reviews.title: Works great at a low price.
customer_reviews.text: Despite some bad reviews I decided to try this tire rack as supposed to the more expensive versions. Ordered on a Friday night and got it Sunday. Packaging was good and all parts included with no damage. Mounted according to instructions and in less than 30 minutes had my winter tires of the garage floor. Was planning on adding a safety cable (since I mounted the rack above garage door) and it is actually recommended by manufacturer. Ordering 2 more for my other tires and rims to get them off floor. Not heavy duty, but certainly holds my 235/45R17 summer 215/55R16 winter tires and rims.
customer_reviews.author: Mats Engstrom

customer_reviews.title: Really good value
customer_reviews.text: I bought a couple of these to store eight 15" race car tires and they work great. I didn't find any issues with the mounting hardware supplied either. Functionally they work great and you can't beat the price. I'm going to buy another rack or two to put my spare wheels on.
customer_reviews.author: dude

customer_reviews.title: Rack em!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent tire rack! Keeps my drag radials ready for the track and out of the way when not in use. Make sure to have a drill and stud finder to help with the install. Measure twice and read those instructions! Sturdy, well built and looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer Bias

customer_reviews.title: Pushing the limits of weight spec with 19” tires for ...
customer_reviews.text: Pushing the limits of weight spec with 19” tires for sure. Had to move the bar out one notch over-spec and mount on 2x4’s away from wall to meet circumference. Decent product for smaller tires, but marginal for sport car tires where we change out summer/winter.
customer_reviews.author: redwine77

customer_reviews.title: Good tire storage solution
customer_reviews.text: This was straight forward and easy to install. Works well to keep my extra set of track tires/wheels off the ground and out of the way when not in use. Just an FYI, this works well for my setup 255/40r17 but if you have tires that are wider than 10 inches this may be too small.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Other than that the rack holds my 19" rims with tires mounted just fine.
customer_reviews.text: Almost bought the $129 tire rack from Tire Rack when I bought my winter tires and rims. I did a quick Google search and this came up on Amazon. I read the other reviews and after receiving the rack, I went to the hardware store and bought new lags for about $2. Other than that the rack holds my 19" rims with tires mounted just fine.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hyde

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price! At Max extension i was able to fit 5 tires, currently only holding tires without wheels, hopefully it will hold well with the added weight, will update review if it doesn't!
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: I put this up in my garage upper wall and ...
customer_reviews.text: I put this up in my garage upper wall and use it to store personal belongings. Placed a flat wooden table across the two bars and use it as a wall shelf, vs. using it to store tires. Bought this at a low price, and was cheaper than buying wood and shelving bars for garage storage. Limitations for my purpose: only can store up to 48" wide worth of items.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: GOOD QUALITY FOR PRICE
customer_reviews.text: FITS MY 911 WHEELS WELL AND OVERALL GOOD QUALITY FOR MONEY. DOES HAVE A SLIGHT BIT OF SAG BUT HOLD WELL. MY FRIEND WAS DOING PULLUPS ON IT NO PROBLEM AND HE WEIGHS 180LBS
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: Buy better mounting hardware!!!
customer_reviews.text: The rack is very well built and easy to install. Two notes are you will want to buy better lag screws. I broke 2 that came with the set just screwing them onto a wood stud. Also if your times are taller than 29" you will need to add a shim behind the frame. I needed to add a 1×3 to push the rack out that extra inch.
customer_reviews.author: Troy Bacon

customer_reviews.title: Works great. Great value.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed and works perfectly. Can’t beat the value on this. I’m using to store 4 16” snow tires on rims and still have room for one more tire, if I ever need it.
customer_reviews.author: Brian from CT

customer_reviews.title: Will buy Another that's how good
customer_reviews.text: Took a hot 5 min to install. Immediately decided I would use it to store by Motorcycle dresser parts on instead. Works perfectly. Now I'm going to get another to actually store my car tires on.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Good quality but forgot to pack mounting hardware
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good quality and easy to install. Ordered two sets and one set didn’t come with any hardware at all. Also, I installed them into a brick/concrete wall and had to buy extra hardware. These only came with hardware to install into studs.
customer_reviews.author: Bruno

customer_reviews.title: Well built and strong.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy wheel storage rack. Good quality and easy to install. Holds my 18x9.5 wheels with not tires. It will be tight once I install tires on the wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Works excellent, easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Holds my son's snow tires. They are 195/65/15. It could easily hold much larger sizes. Could also be used for other purposes such as a shelf.
customer_reviews.author: Warren B

customer_reviews.title: Good product bad bolts
customer_reviews.text: The tire rack itself is very sturdy and surprisingly easy to install along with the whole diagram my only gripe is bolts are very cheap and broke during application my suggestion is not to use the hardware it comes with the purchase yourself Bigger bolts from Lowes or Home Depot that will not break
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price. Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived very fast! Packaged nicely and effectively. Installed this at my mother in laws house for her to store her winter tires. She was so happy to see the result! They look awesome!
customer_reviews.author: DynamicReviews

customer_reviews.title: Well built good price and very versital.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assembling it. The studs and with of your tires determines the rack placement and size. I fit x4 tire size 215-55-14 plus the spare in it. Could fit a bit bigger set of tires. Maybe up to 4x 255 wide. Don’t quote me but guessing.
customer_reviews.author: awdskyline

customer_reviews.title: Rusted upon arrival
customer_reviews.text: First one, saw some rusted dust in the bag, opened it, the metal was rusted under the paint/powdercoating. Requested an exchange, and the second one, same rusted dust, didn't even have to open the bag, and saw the rust.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Get this if you want to reclaim floor space. I have 4 cars, each have snow tires and summer tires. I have 4 of these racks, keeping 16 tires neatly organized
customer_reviews.author: JOHN D.

customer_reviews.title: Strong Tire Storage Rack! EZ Install!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy it’s this product. Saves tons of room in my garage. Super sturdy and easy to install with common tools.
customer_reviews.author: STR

customer_reviews.title: So good I bought a 2nd one.
customer_reviews.text: Holds tires, it's sturdy and easy to assemble and mount. I bought a 2nd one as a result of buying the first one.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the dollar.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and use. No complaints here. Folding up is a nice feature to keep it out of the way when not in use. I see it lasting for years and years.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Just the Facts

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I paid $37. For that money you can’t build it cheaper. Install was easy. Cross bars sag a very little bit when loaded but with telescoping cross bars that was completely expected. Still completely confident in its robustness for my 4 Dodge Dart winter/summer tire and wheel combos.
customer_reviews.author: Jon B

customer_reviews.title: Great value tire rack
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I have three racks installed on a cinderblock wall. My only advice is to measure the height from the ceiling with the rack and a tire before drilling mounting holes.
customer_reviews.author: Steve J

customer_reviews.title: Value pricing, exactly what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: Easy install, make sure your studs are in line with how wide your tires will make it. If it doesn’t line up use a backer (2x6’s attached to studs. I put 4 32” sand tires with rims on it for a rzr. Fit barely. It’s sturdy enough for me to stand underneath when the kids slam the garage door :)
customer_reviews.author: @MtPassIT

customer_reviews.title: Great investment!
customer_reviews.text: This does exactly what I needed. Great value for sure. Probably going to buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Ram Guy

customer_reviews.title: A nice sturdy tire rack
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to hold a set of off season tires (no rims) for my Nissan Leaf. Install was easy. The shelf is sturdy and seems well thought out. Overall very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Tire Rack!
customer_reviews.text: Great price and easy to install! Bought two for the garage and they installed with no issues. I did use larger lag bolts to secure. Otherwise very easy to assemble. Tires fit no problem and I am very happy to have them off the floor!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great space saver
customer_reviews.text: I bought the tire rack to help clear up some room in the new garage. The rack arrived quickly and took just minutes to assemble. After reading reviews of the lag screws snapping when installing, I chose not to risk it and bought some from the hardware store. So far, it's holding up great with my heavy wheels and snow tires. It opened up the space nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Not for wide tires! 43” useable width, not 48”
customer_reviews.text: I only am able to fit thee 295 tires on the rack instead of four. 295x4=1180mm or 46.5”, should fit one might think. But the advertised 48” is the distance of the bolt holes, not the actual usable width! Bummer. With a slightly optimized construction these tires would actually fit. No complains else wise. Seams solid and is easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: JuanSolo

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Used this to hold a set of tires in my garage for my Mustang GT. outstanding product for the price and it holds a lot of weight.
customer_reviews.author: Sean M. Walsh

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat these for the price!! Super strong & easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tire racks. Installation was very simple and they are well built. I purchased 3 of these and each one was a breeze to put up. They allowed me to get all tires off the ground. After looking at making tire racks myself out of wood, I realized that I couldn't possibly make something this nice for so cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Brady

customer_reviews.title: Product Rusted
customer_reviews.text: Cross bars on this product were rusted. I requested a replacement and it was rusted too. In addition the second order was previously opened and probably returned. Kevin from Maxxhaul wanted me to pay for shipping to get the cross bars in a form without rust. Just looking to get the product in new form, not looking to pay the vendor additional shipping to do so. Poor product and customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Milanovich

customer_reviews.title: Great price, quality materials, what're you waiting for?
customer_reviews.text: This rack is awesome! For years now I've been cramming my winter tires in a storage closet. I dreaded every time I went to swap tires. The quality of this is very tough. Some reviews mention low quality hardware but I didn't notice an issue. Very easy to install and it freed up my storage closet! Great price and I'm very satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Got the product and followed instructions to a T the rails going from each side collapsed after setting my wheels and rims for my car on them was very disappointing 😑 would have worked great probably without wheels on the tires and just used it as a tire rack
customer_reviews.author: steven

customer_reviews.title: GARBAGE LAG BOLTS!!!
customer_reviews.text: Was installing by hand into studs. Predrilled bigger than I normally would. Was not even snug and one of the lag bolts twisted and sheared in the middle. Serious safety hazard. Now I need to go go buy replacement bolts and reposition the entire rack because there is half a bolt in one of the holes.
customer_reviews.author: Timbo

customer_reviews.title: Easier than making your own
customer_reviews.text: Probably the cheapest and easiest solution to store your spare wheels and tires up and out of the way. Fit a set of 17” SUV wheels, no problem. Feels very secure when attached to studs. I highly recommend pre-drilling to avoid breaking the lag bolt during installation.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and very strong
customer_reviews.text: Used to store large goodyear gatorbacks. Very easy to install and adjust to fit the tires
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived quickly with all the necessary steps to install. If you follow the instructions installation is easy and the final result is a fairly sturdy tire rack.
customer_reviews.author: User 1e

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase Even The Second Time
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about 3 years ago and liked them in my last house. I decided I wanted to go with them again and my new house, and again have really grown to appreciate these.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Great little rack that folds away when not in use
customer_reviews.text: Great little rack that folds away when not in use. I bought it for storing my motorcycle tires and wheels... It is simple to use, good quality, and comes partially assembled. My other rack did not fold away... I'm like this one a lot!
customer_reviews.author: Tom V

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Arrived in damaged box. Did not come with the horizontal bars that hold the tires.
customer_reviews.author: chris  Mazzarella

customer_reviews.title: Measure before you buy.
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Just keep in mind that the width of your tires may not line up perfectly with the center your studs. I had to build a bracket and buy different hardware to make up for this. Not a big deal but just keep it in mind when purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Monaco

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job in Spite of Unclear instructions
customer_reviews.text: Seems well made and somewhat easy to install but instructions are printed too small to help you how to assemble. Have additional parts I still do not know what they are for? Larger illustrations or photos would have helped.
customer_reviews.author: upmacman

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tire rack, great value!
customer_reviews.text: Great unit and I was surprised at how affordable it is. Purchased it to store my second set of wheels. Easy to assemble and install. I was able to do it without help. Definitely predrill holes and use a level.
customer_reviews.author: W. Socha

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, strong enough, easy install.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! Tires stored securely on wall of garage out of the way. I now have two. Can’t beat the price. Make sure you put the low enough for the size of the tires. My large tires only hit the front bar, but this is not a problem at all. Work great!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Weak bolts, great shelf.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 3 of these and they're great for storing my race wheels off the ground. Original bolts are weak, replaced with new ones and all is good.
customer_reviews.author: James R Haile

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy tire/wheel rack!
customer_reviews.text: Well made product, very sturdy if mounted correctly to wall studs. My wheels were just over 240lbs so the 300lb capacity is adequate.
customer_reviews.author: CWELL76

customer_reviews.title: Fit my sport sedans tires easily - and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Fit my S4’s tires zero issue. Adjusted to 48” for 16” on center studs in my garage. Just do the prework to make sure you’ve got the stud and it’ll be a snap to install.
customer_reviews.author: The Fredericksen’s

customer_reviews.title: Awesomeness
customer_reviews.text: These are great for my race trailer, easy fold out of the way...
customer_reviews.author: Josh Havens

customer_reviews.title: Tire Rack - perfect for what I need
customer_reviews.text: This tire rack (MaxxHaul 70489 Capacity Foldable Tire Rack) is just what I needed to store our winter or summer tires. It helped clear up space in our garage. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: JCCDADDYO

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Nice product and a good value. Lower support bar could be a little more sturdy, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Bob P.

customer_reviews.title: Good but Be carefull with tire size.
customer_reviews.text: It will fit perfectly up an 18-inch tire set. The 19 wheels will fit on the limit - better look for something else. Also, the color is not exactly like in the picture, it's more gray than black.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy install
customer_reviews.text: Includes lag screws. The frame is pre-assembled, 15 minute install. Really solid rack, holds 4 wheels, no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Chandler

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: This rack is great. It holds 4 17 x 8 tires perfectly and is very sturdy. It does have room to expand as well. I did switch out the bolts. I was not sure how good they were and I didn't want to risk it. Highly recommend if you need a good rack for spare wheels and tires.
customer_reviews.author: Judson Brown

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: The instructions weren't as clear as they could be, but it's so easy to install it didn't really make a difference. I used some other amazong reviews as guidance for pre drilling the holes in it. Overall it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install.  Folds flat against wall if needed.  Easily holds 5 tires.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a rack to hold a few, in an emergency, tires. Right off, it is very easy to install. I put the 4 new tires for our van (225-65/17's) on it as well as an extra tire for the truck with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon S Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Worked as described. Used supplied hardware. Probably could use upgraded hardware, but worked out okay. Made me nervous at first. Been holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Yuknek

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Four stars only because the construction couldn't be a little more solid. But for the price your really cant complain.
customer_reviews.author: Keith E. Sleezer

customer_reviews.title: Judge for yourself. Mine are awesome though
customer_reviews.text: The price was awesome. I was going to buy a $100 rack from tire until I saw these. I purchased 3. Very easy to assemble. They feel sturdy. I didn't break any lag bolts. Holds my 18x9.5 17's, as 22's. No problem. The reviews I read before purchasing were great. I'm satisfied. Well worth the money. I put them up myself....without help. It wasn't difficult. I think I'll order one more and add a piece of wood to use as a work station.
customer_reviews.author: jahlid manly

customer_reviews.title: Easy, sturdy and quality
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and very good quality. Can't beat the price either!
customer_reviews.author: Jcv

customer_reviews.title: Great Tire Rack
customer_reviews.text: This product was easy to install and pretty sturdy. I had my doubts at first when opening the box but overall I’m pretty happy with it now that it’s up!
customer_reviews.author: Trevar

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly, cleans up garage nicely
customer_reviews.text: Very easy assembly, very good price point! I only have tires on them right now but soon they'll have wheels with mounted tires, I hope to not have issues, and I doubt I will!
customer_reviews.author: Sawyer Stearns

customer_reviews.title: GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Shipped fast, husband installed on the wall of the garage and it holds his spare set of truck tires and wheels perfectly. He's happy - I'm happy! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Georgia

customer_reviews.title: Not really what they claim
customer_reviews.text: The bars bent the first time I used it. I had to mount it through the wall so now I'm stuck with the mounting holes and a bent tire rack. These are small 13" MG tires. It should have handled these and it bent like banana.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Dougherty

customer_reviews.title: The rack is sturdy and does what it needs to do as long ...
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these for two separate sets of tires/wheels. The rack is sturdy and does what it needs to do as long as you get it drilled into studs. Overall, pretty happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Dudewhaaaat

customer_reviews.title: Hurray!  More floor space!
customer_reviews.text: Easy installation and will take 5 standard tires. 4 Tires for my 3/4 ton.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy A.  Allen

customer_reviews.title: Very solid and practical rack
customer_reviews.text: I have the my racing tires of my car on this racks. Easy to install and very solid construction. and I love that when not in use the fold very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: so good. Easy to install and includes all necessary hardware ...
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Easy to install and includes all necessary hardware to mount. Received it today and took about 30 minutes to install. Holds my 18" BMW ZHP wheels perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: TeeDub

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Nice to get the extra wheels and tires off of the floor so I can have more room on the floor for more junk!
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: my wheels didn't fit
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately my wheels and tires didn't fit. I tried by SUV 22 inch and my car 19 inch wheels with tires. when I say they didnt fit, I mean that the tires did not touch the back bar. They would rest on the wall and only be supported on the front bar.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Powdered coated finish in gray, looks and holds up great.
customer_reviews.text: Hung this up in my garage and anchored it to the concrete wall. Holding up nicely and took a little longer cause I made sure it was at the right height. Make sure you measure twice and have it spaced enough for your tires cause once it's up, you don't want to drill all over again. It folds when not in use and the finish is nice. Steel is strong and not cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly like I wanted it to
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly like I wanted it to. I can't believe what ones costing four times more would do, except maybe be painted red.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C Howard

customer_reviews.title: I'm taking others advice and buying good lag bolts to install it before I have trouble
customer_reviews.text: I'm taking others advice and buying good lag bolts to install it before I have trouble. It's nice otherwise and glad I finally bought one
customer_reviews.author: Example: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Solid product. Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Just fit my wide tires but it fit! No issues installing and really happy with the result.
customer_reviews.author: Scott D. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Good value.
customer_reviews.text: For the money, no big complaints. It seems solid, and was easy to install. My only issue, was the same as someone else mentioned. I was securing the last of 6 lag bolts, and it broke off in the wall. I had drilled pilot holes, but it broke. So, maybe the hardware could be better. It easily accommodates my 17" wheels with OD of about 26".
customer_reviews.author: Tlk2003

customer_reviews.title: Great and easy design
customer_reviews.text: Great and easy design, bolted right up to the studs in unfinished part of garage. It will fold up too if not in use!
customer_reviews.author: J. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: You don't get what you pay for here, you get more!
customer_reviews.text: I'm loving this tire rack! Install was easy and it feels nice and sturdy. Since I was installing this on a cinder block wall, I didn't use the included lag bolts, but I didn't have to worry about finding studs. The way it folds is a little strange to me, but it folds up nearly completely flat against the wall. I've used the Hyloft tire rack in my enclosed trailer and it works just fine, but there were more components that came loose out of the box. If you're looking for a simple, cheap tire rack, this is the one!
customer_reviews.author: Kadius

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed to store winter tires/rims.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and mount. Gets the tires off the garage floor and out of the way for the summer.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

product_meta.title: MAXXHAUL 70489 Capacity Foldable Tire Rack (300-lb), Black
product_meta.description: Our MaxxHaul Foldable Wall Mount Tire Rack is your ultimate space saver. Gives your floor more room and neatly organized your spare tires, snow tires or summer tires. Easily install on your wall and folds away when not in use. All steel construction with powder coat finish will provide years of service. Will accommodate four standard tires.
feature_bullets: All heavy duty steel construction with rigid steel tubing
Folds up against wall when not in use

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars421 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
